detect_operator(image_plus, +).
detect_operator(image_minus, -).
detect_operator(image_multiply, *).
detect_operator(image_divide, /).
detect_all([N], [N2]) :- 
 detect_number(N, N2).
detect_all([N,O|T], [N2,O2|T2]) :- 
 detect_number(N, N2), 
 detect_operator(O, O2), 
 detect_all(T, T2).
almost_equal(X, Y) :- 
 ground(Y), 
 abs(X - Y) < 0.0001.
almost_equal(X, Y) :- 
 var(Y), 
 Y is float(X).
expression(Images, Result) :- 
 detect_all(Images, Symbols), 
 parse(Symbols, Result).
parse([N], R) :- 
 almost_equal(N, R).
parse([N1, +, N2], R) :-
    almost_equal(R, N1 + N2).
parse([N1, -, N2], R) :-
    almost_equal(R, N1 - N2).
parse([N1, *, N2], R) :-
    almost_equal(R, N1 * N2).
parse([N1, /, N2], R) :-
    almost_equal(R, N1 / N2).
parse([N1, Op, N2|Rest], R) :-
    parse([N1, Op, N2], Temp),
    parse([Temp|Rest], R).
query(expression([image_2, image_divide, image_3, image_plus, image_3, image_minus, image_2, image_multiply, image_7], X)).
final_report: The generated code is not valid as it fails to handle the expression parsing correctly, leading to a runtime error. The original code successfully parses and evaluates complex expressions by recursively breaking them down, while the generated code attempts to handle expressions in pairs, which doesn't work for nested operations. The error occurs because the generated code's 'almost_equal' predicate is called with non-ground arguments, violating its expected usage.
